Getting Started

This guide will help you get started with the Memory Evolutive Systems (MES) package.

Installation

To install MES, use Julia's package manager:

using Pkg
Pkg.add("MES")

Basic Usage

Creating Categories

The fundamental structure in MES is a category. Here's how to create one:

using MES

# Create a simple category
objects = ["A", "B", "C"]
morphisms = Dict(
    ("A", "A") => ["id_A"],  # Identity morphism
    ("B", "B") => ["id_B"],  # Identity morphism
    ("C", "C") => ["id_C"],  # Identity morphism
    ("A", "B") => ["f"],     # Morphism from A to B
    ("B", "C") => ["g"]      # Morphism from B to C
)

# Create the category
category = create_category(objects, morphisms)

# Verify category properties
@assert verify_category(category)
@assert verify_composition_closure(category)
@assert verify_identity_existence(category)

Working with Patterns

Patterns represent structures within categories:

# Create a pattern
pattern_objects = ["A", "B"]
pattern_links = [("A", "B")]
pattern = create_pattern(category, pattern_objects, pattern_links)

# Calculate colimit
colimit = calculate_colimit(pattern)
println("Colimit object: ", colimit[:object])
for (obj, morph) in colimit[:morphisms]
    println("Morphism from $obj: $morph")
end

Using Memory Systems

Memory systems allow you to store and retrieve information:

# Create a memory system
memory = MemorySystem(category)

# Store some data
store!(memory, "state", "active")
store!(memory, "timestamp", "2024-03-25T12:00:00")

# Retrieve data
current_state = retrieve(memory, "state")
println("Current state: $current_state")

Pattern Synchronization

You can synchronize patterns across different contexts:

# Create two categories
cat1 = create_category(
    ["A", "B"],
    Dict(
        ("A", "A") => ["id_A"],
        ("B", "B") => ["id_B"],
        ("A", "B") => ["f"]
    )
)

cat2 = create_category(
    ["X", "Y"],
    Dict(
        ("X", "X") => ["id_X"],
        ("Y", "Y") => ["id_Y"],
        ("X", "Y") => ["g"]
    )
)

# Create patterns
pattern1 = create_pattern(cat1, ["A", "B"], [("A", "B")])
pattern2 = create_pattern(cat2, ["X", "Y"], [("X", "Y")])

# Create synchronization
sync = Synchronization(pattern1, pattern2)
@assert verify_synchronization(sync)

  2. Explore practical examples of using MES
  3. Study the mathematical foundations in the theory section
